metadata.title: CVE-2024-53103 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:hv_sock: Initializing vsk->trans to NULL to prevent a dangling pointerWhen hvs is released, there is a possibility that vsk->trans may notbe initialized to NULL, which could lead to a dangling pointer.This issue is resolved by initializing vsk->trans to NULL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-131-generic - 5.15.0-131.141
linux-image-5.15.0-131-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-131.141
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-131-generic - 5.15.0-131.141
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-131-generic-64k - 5.15.0-131.141
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1073-kvm - 5.15.0-1073.78
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1079-azure - 5.15.0-1079.88
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1075-gcp - 5.15.0-1075.84
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1073-gke - 5.15.0-1073.79
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1059-gkeop - 5.15.0-1059.67
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1069-ibm - 5.15.0-1069.72
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1072-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1072.78
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-131-lowlatency - 5.15.0-131.141
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-131-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-131.141
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1071-nvidia - 5.15.0-1071.72
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1071-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1071.72
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1074-oracle - 5.15.0-1074.80
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1071-raspi - 5.15.0-1071.74
No subscription required
